comments:

Using eclipse-SDK-3.1RC3-win32 in a multithreaded application. Have problem 
when trying debug the source code.

Have tried with older version of Eclipse (RC1 and M7) but nothing changed.

Do you have steps to reproduce? It looks like you have a debug sessions that 
does not have a source locator - not sure how that would happen.

(In reply to comment #1)
> Do you have steps to reproduce? It looks like you have a debug sessions that 
> does not have a source locator - not sure how that would happen.

Yes. I'm just importing the java projects I need and start the Tomcat 5 server 
using the com.sysdeo.eclipse.tomcat_3.1.0.beta plugin.

No matter if I use .class or .jar file in the Tomcat's server and common 
classloaders. Each .jar file I generate and load is mapped to a java project.

Compilation of (Java5) code works.

I reach the breakpoint(s) and see the line number but can't follow the steps 
using "Step Over", "Step into"... even though the pointer steps through the 
code each time I press the "Step..." buttons.

When I try to open/view the lines in the "Variables" perspective, I 
get "Exception processing ....".

BUT I can view some other lines/objects listed in the "Variables" perspective.

As I said, I can step through the calls without seen the source code 
accordingly. It's not mapped for some reason.

Thanks!
Ugur

Marking as RC4 candidate. We should be checking for null on 
ILaunch.getSourceLocator() (it is spec'd to be able to return null).

Created an attachment (id=23676)
Null check

Patch adds null check. Note that when the source locator for a launch is null,
we cannot perform any evaluations for the associated debug session, as we
cannot resolve the associated source elements (and Java project) for a given
stack frame, needed to compile codes snippets.
CC'ing Darin (S) and Dirk for RC4 approval.

(In reply to comment #7)
> +1.
